review: I was hoping to make this a five start review but there are some cons or questions that have yet to be answered. Note, I am coming from a WD TV Live Media Player (with Netflix) to this device.Note I am an Amazon Prime member for many years and figured Prime Videos was worth checking out.Pros:- FAST, Easy to setup, already was configured with my account- Kids found games and other programming right away- slim box and ergonomic remoteCONS:- Can't play movies from the USB port (if so tell me how and I will update this review)- Can't find my DLNA/UPNP devices on my network- example I have a WD NAS with 100s of movies and this device can't see it :(- Can't play MKV format/Container.  this is a very common container for content.  yet Xbox One, WD, and other devices support it.- Amazon Prime Video - Hmmm.  explain to me the 40,000 videos I can watch?  it seems that every TV series I need to purchase even if its not current, albeit some older not so popular stuff is free but I can't get Modern Family for example without paying for it on top of my Prime membership.- can't configure my apps from my PC.  setting up Netflix, and other apps from a PC would be nice.- no iPhone Remote app like WD or Plex  have- My Windows 8/8.1/10 computers can't "send" (think Mirrorcast/glass) to the device.  so I need to (a) make the format match and (b) put it up on Amazon cloud (Hello I am a OneDrive/GDrive - I don't need another drive or stream of the cloud).I will wait about a week then return if I can't find answers to these.  right now an XBOX One to replace my 360 and my WD HD TV Live box are all better (IMO)
